intro: Sigesbeckia agrestis, commonly known as the field sigesbeckia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from summer to autumn. Its hairy stems and leaves are often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sigesbeckia agrestis is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
